quests.name: REFERENCE
quests.xml:
<!-- Pause the quest until all conditions are fulfilled. All attributes are optional. -->
<!-- have-item accepts: semicolon separated list of items that the player must possess -->
<!-- at-dest accepts: single destination name -->
<!-- no-enemy-at-dest: semicolon separated list of destination names that must be cleared of enemies -->
<!-- not-at-dest: single destination name -->
<!-- have-credits: number of credits that player must possess -->
<!-- trigger: if omitted condition is triggered automatically. If present the condition is triggered with a button in the Radar View with the text set to the provided string -->
<condition have-item="Shiny Meteorite;Blue seeds" at-dest="Backwater" no-enemy-at-dest="Baola" not-at-dest="Backwater" have-credits="3000" trigger="EXPLORE"/>

<!-- Add a lootable item to the destination. -->
<place-item dest="Backwater" item="Shiny Meteorite"/>

<!-- Add a purchasable item to the destination's trader. -->
<place-inventory dest="Backwater" item="Phased Ray"/>

<!-- Set enemy at destination -->
<place-enemy dest="Backwater" enemy="Monitor Drone"/>

<!-- Display a message.
If the optional ok and cancel attributes are present they will appear as buttons. Cancel will rewinds the quest one step, so that the same trigger that triggered the quest will display the same message the next turn. Ok will progress the quest as normally. 
If the optional ok-goto="x" and cancel-goto="x" attributes are present ok and cancel will jump to the corresponding <mark id="x"/> tags in this script.
-->
<dialog>"Hey, hitchhiker!"</dialog>
<dialog ok="YES PLEASE" cancel="NO THANKS">"Would you like some tea?"</dialog>
<dialog ok="YES PLEASE" cancel="NO THANKS" ok-goto="tea_drink" cancel-goto="end_quest">"Would you like some tea?"</dialog>

<!-- Include this quest in the quest list. -->
<add-to-quest-list/>
<!-- Add item or credits to the player's inventory. -->
<give credits="900"/>
<give item="Phased Ray"/>

<!-- Remove an item or credits from the player's inventory. -->
<take credits="900"/>
<take item="Phased Ray"/>

<!-- Place a quest marker on the map. color and icon attributes are optional. icon can take these values: "arrow", "square", "enter", "exit". A quest can only have a single map marker. -->
<mark-on-map dest="Samson's Folly" color="0F0" icon="arrow"/>

<!-- Change the player's ship. -->
<change-ship ship="Kerr Clipper"/>

<!-- Clear the map marker for this quest. -->
<remove-map-marker/>

<!-- Transports the player to another destination. -->
<travel dest="Backwater"/>

<!-- Labels this line in the script. This mark can then be referred to in goto directives -->
<mark id="quest_position" />

<!-- Sets the quest progress to the <mark/> tag with the provided id -->
<goto mark="quest_position"/>

<!-- A goto directive that modified another quest -->
<modify-quest quest="A Quest Name" goto-mark="quest_position"/>

quests.name: Fast Forward
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Fast Forward" />
<dialog ok="FAST FORWARD!" cancel="NOT NOW">*Thank you Beta tester for your work*
Would you like to skip the tutorial zone?</dialog>
<dialog>`Some quests will trigger dialogs now, it will be a bit weird but just hang in there.`</dialog>
<give credits="300"/>
<give item="EM Pulse;Photon Ray;Piercing Beam;Autogun Mk3;Repair Kit;Mk0 Reactor;Lepton Shield;Crew of SS Thunder;Blue seeds"/>
<change-ship ship="Kerr Runner"/>
<travel dest="The Bush Transfer Buoy"/>

quests.name: Far Forward
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Far Forward" />
<dialog ok="FAST FORWARD!" cancel="NOT NOW">*Thank you Beta tester for your work*
Would you like to skip to level 6 in Soma space?</dialog>
<dialog>`Some quests will trigger dialogs now, it will be a bit weird but just hang in there.`</dialog>
<give credits="300"/>
<give item="Mk6 Battery;Aegis Cell;Healing Kit;Mk4 Reactor;Aegis Inducer;Healing Robot;Mk6 Capacitor;Pauli Shield;Fluid Armor;Au Disruptor;Helix Driver;Apex Beam;Aural Pulse;Nucleon Ray;Railgun;Nano Repairers"/>
<change-ship ship="CES Interplan"/>
<travel dest="Soma Transfer Buoy"/>

quests.name: Start of an adventure
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Backwater"/>
<place-item dest="Backwater" item="Shiny Meteorite"/>
<dialog>The captain wakes you up.
_"Hey, hitchhiker! This is your stop."_
</dialog>
<dialog>You are at the area where you saw the meteorite hit. It had a _weird_ signature.

If you explore the area you might score big time!</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<hint layout="treasure">Tap to collect treasure</hint>

<condition have-item="Shiny Meteorite"/>
<dialog model="Rover">You find the meteorite resting on the ground.
  
A shiny lump that is surprisingly light when you load it into the rover.</dialog>
<dialog>You should be able to *TRADE* the meteorite for some hard cash.</dialog>
<hint layout="trade">Sell your treasures here</hint>

<condition have-credits="200"/>
<dialog>_"Nice doing business with ya kid! Say, with that money you can buy a starship."_

_"Enter the *SHIPYARD* if you are interested."_</dialog>
<hint layout="shipyard">Buy a starship here</hint>

<condition have-ship="Kerr Clipper" />
<dialog>_"Now you can *LIFT OFF* and leave this planet."_

_"And good luck kid! It is dangerous out there."_</dialog>
<hint layout="liftoff">Leave this world</hint>
<mark-on-map dest="Samson's Folly"/>

<condition at-dest="Samson's Folly"/>
<dialog>_"My friend at Backwater said you would be coming."_

_"We have a cheap *Rusty Autogun* in stock. You are welcome to *LAND* and *TRADE* with us here at Samson's Folly."_</dialog>
<hint layout="quest">Review you objectives here</hint>

<condition have-item="Rusty Autogun"/>
<dialog>You now have a Rusty Autogun, a basic weapon. Tap your ship hologram to open your *PROFILE* and *INSTALL* your new weapon</dialog>
<hint layout="profile">Install your equipment here</hint>

<condition installed-item="Rusty Autogun"/>
<hint layout="profile"></hint>
<dialog>_"I always let my customers try their new gear"_

_"Head over to my Buoy where I have target drone lined up."_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Samson's Buoy" />

<condition no-enemy-at-dest="Samson's Buoy" />
<place-inventory dest="Samson's Folly" item="Cutting Beam;EM Pulse"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Samson's Folly" />
<dialog>_"Good. Now you should try to defeat a drone that can self-repair. Get back to *Samson's Folly* where I have a *Cutting Beam* and an *EM Pulse* for you."_</dialog>

<condition at-dest="Samson's Folly" have-item="Cutting Beam;EM Pulse" />
<dialog>_"Here, take this *Combat Handbook*. Included in the price. It will be available in your *LOG* computer in the future."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"The Rugged Drone is waiting for you at *Samson's Training Ground*, go there."_</dialog>
<give item="Combat Handbook"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Samson's Training Ground" />

<condition no-enemy-at-dest="Samson's Training Ground" />
<dialog>Samson radios you.

_"Looking good kid! Now you have the basic skills needed out here in the nebula."_

_"Good luck!"_</dialog>

quests.name: Shady spacer
quests.xml:
<place-item dest="Shady" item="Shady Boxes"/>
<condition at-dest="Shady"/>
<dialog model="Rusty Ship">A rusty ship radios you.

_"Fellow spacer! There is nice loot on this moon but my landing gear is busted. If you *LAND* and help me *EXPLORE* I'll reward you."_</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<mark-on-map dest="Shady" />
<condition have-item="Shady Boxes"/>
<dialog model="Rusty Ship">The eager spacer thank you several times for helping her with the boxes. You receive a small reward and you hope you don't see her again.</dialog>
<give credits="100"/>
<take item="Shady Boxes"/>

quests.name: Peril at Buoy 72
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Buoy 68"/>
<dialog model="Kerr Runner">A private yacht hails you.

_"Help us. The way ahead is blocked by a malfunctioning drone. We don't dare to proceed."_

_"Your ship is armed, can you clear the path for us!"_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Buoy 72"/>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<condition no-enemy-at-dest="Buoy 72"/>
<dialog model="Kerr Runner">_"Thank you for clearing the way for us! Here, take this *Repair Kit*, you need it more than we do."_</dialog>
<dialog>The *Repair Kit* is a _tool with a cooldown_. When used in battle it will repair your hull. It can only be used once per battle.</dialog>
<give item="Repair Kit"/>
<dialog model="Kerr Runner">When questioned why they were here in the Outback they say they wanted to see the flowers of the *Blue Forest*.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Blue Forest" />
<condition have-item="Blue seeds" />

quests.name: Combat Handbook
quests.xml:
<condition have-item="Combat Handbook" />
<add-to-quest-list/>
<take item="Combat Handbook"/>
<dialog voice="none">_SPACE COMBAT, 3rd EDITION_
*1.* Armored opponents
*2.* Shielded opponents
*3.* Energy consuming opponents
*4.* Critical hits
*5.* Cooldown
</dialog>
<dialog voice="none">*ARMORED OPPONENTS*
An opponent with a strong _hull_ can be dispatched if your ship regenerates its _hull_ or _shield_ fast enough. Take care to install modules and tools that allow you to perform field repairs.</dialog>
<dialog voice="none">*SHIELDED OPPONENTS*
A shielded opponent can block weak _hull_ damage.
You must do more _hull_ damage than what can be absorbed by the shields. Reduce the shields of a target with _shield_ damage attacks.</dialog>
<dialog voice="none">*ENERGY CONSUMING OPPONENTS*
An opponent that consumes energy can be crippled by attacking with an _energy_ weapon. A ship with an empty energy buffer is a sitting duck that can be attacked with _shield_ or _hull_ damage.</dialog>
<dialog voice="none">*CRITICAL HITS*
A _critical hit_ will disable one of the target's subsystems.
A wise combatant has redundant shield generators and weapons to mitigate the effect of the enemy's critical hits.</dialog>
<dialog voice="none">*COOLDOWN*
Some weapons and tools require cooldown. This means they can only be used once per battle, but they are often powerful.</dialog>

quests.name: Outback Mining
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Outback A563" />
<dialog model="Rusty Ship">A scruffy ship is slowly passing by this asteroid. You radio it and ask if anything is wrong.</dialog>
<dialog model="Rusty Ship">_"Hey man! I'm ok, my ship is just a bit overloaded. The area *north* of here is full of minerals that I have been mining.

You should go there. More than enough for everyone."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"There might be some aggressive drones out there.
Here, take this *Slug Driver*. A gift to you. It has to recharge between uses but packs a good punch."_</dialog>
<give item="Slug Driver"/>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<mark-on-map dest="Outback A089" />
<condition have-item="Last message" />
<modify-quest quest="Last Message" goto-mark="read-message"/>
<take item="Last message"/>

quests.name: Last Message
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Tau Pavonis" />
<mark id="read-message"/>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<dialog>As you explore the asteroid you find a crashed ship. Inside you find the crew.
Dead.
And a message.
  
Words from dying explorers.</dialog>
<dialog>_We have been attacked by hacked Drones. They are not malfunctioning, someone is doing this to them._</dialog>

quests.name: Maxwell Station
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Maxwell Station"/>
<dialog model="Ring Station">As you approach a transmission is received from Maxwell Station.</dialog>
<dialog model="Ring Station">_"Welcome to Maxwell station, you have been assigned to landing pad Beta Twelve."_</dialog>

<dialog model="Service Robot">After a secure landing, you enter the metallic hum of the hangar. You are approached by a service robot.</dialog>
<dialog model="Service Robot">_"Greetings traveller and welcome to Maxwell Station. If you need a tour or assistance during your visit. Please let us know."_</dialog>

<condition at-dest="Maxwell Station" trigger="TAKE TOUR"/>
<dialog model="Service Robot">_"Here at Maxwell Station, we strive to make your adventures throughout the Nebula as convenient as possible."_</dialog>
<dialog model="Service Robot">_"At the Maxwell Trader, you will find some of the best prices on goods from the whole galaxy with adequate guarantees."_</dialog>
<dialog model="Service Robot">_"The well known Captain Maxwell was the first to explore this whole nebula. And opened the doors to this open hangar over one hundred years ago. Here all beings are welcome to share tales and trade goods."_</dialog>
<dialog model="Service Robot">_"Maxwell is currently head of developing the Vortec technology which will greatly improve travel speeds within the nebula."_</dialog>
<dialog model="Service Robot">_"Please enjoy your stay. If you need any further assistance. Please let us know."_</dialog>

quests.name: Joe's
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Joe's Bar"/>

<dialog ok="JOE'S!" cancel="no thanks">The glare off the neon sign spelling _"JOE'S BAR"_ leaves a good impression on your eyes as you hover the landing pads at Joe's.</dialog>
<dialog ok="Who?" cancel="What?">_"How are yez!?"_ Calls a man as he wobbles to your ship.</dialog>
<dialog>The man gives the ship a hug and turn toward you, still holding onto the ship as not to fall on his nose, clearly drunk.</dialog>
<dialog ok="I got it in this condition">_"I've been lookin' round for yeh for six months! yeh're a Wreck. Ye arn't lookin' after her. "_</dialog>
<dialog ok="Really?">_"This was my vessel see. Don't worry. It's just a wee lovely to see her after so many years."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"Aye. Say you don't want to get an Autogun Mk3 for a deal, I got one but I need liquor badly."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"Aint got nothin good in these parts. Have ta go to Smacky's to get anything good."_</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<mark-on-map dest="Smacky's" />


<condition at-dest="Smacky's" trigger="ENTER SMACKY'S" have-credits="10" />
<dialog ok="Something to drink please" cancel="Nothing im heading out">This bar has damp lightning and is quiet, most guests are playing pool further in. You go up to the bartender.
_"What can I get you this fine eveninin' sir?"_</dialog>
<dialog>The bartender pours a beer and you ask for Brandons liqour.</dialog>
<dialog>_"We are all out of that feller, Brandon's is the darndest best liqour out there, but they have stopped deliverin."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"I can't tell ye why, but i think the is somethin fishy going on. The distillery is only a couple of jumps from here."_</dialog>

<take credits="10"/>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<mark-on-map dest="Brandons" />

<condition at-dest="Brandons" trigger="INVESTIGATE" />
<dialog>You navigate around space junk that is orbiting the distillery, there is no activity to be seen</dialog>
  
<dialog>A broken door lets you inside a part of the distillery where there are some broken bottles. Someone seem to have left in a hurry.</dialog>

<dialog ok="This is what he wanted" cancel="Put it down">You find an intact bottle of Brandon's Single Malt!</dialog>
<dialog>You go to your ship and take off.</dialog>
<give item="Brandons Whiskey"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Joe's Bar" />


<condition have-item="Brandons Whiskey" at-dest="Joe's Bar" trigger="TALK TO DRUNKARD"/>
<dialog ok="Do you have The Mk3?" cancel="Not Yet.">_"Can't believe ye'r back, wha? Ye found any liquor yet?"_</dialog>

<dialog>_"Aw, c'mon, ofcourse. I have it in a garage downere"_ He takes the bottle out of your hand and sips it.</dialog>
<take item="Brandons Whiskey"/>
<dialog>_"Here we're, good as new. Now for yeh this might be a high quality automatic machine gun..."_</dialog>
<dialog ok="Not what we agreed" cancel="You are changing the deal">_"For me, it's an investment. I'm going to have ye ta help me with another thing."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"Houl' on. Ye see I'm Mr. Brandon"_
He says and pulls down his hood. One if his eyes,replaced with a cyborg techpiece.</dialog>
<dialog>_"Those fuckers have shut down me distillery. ey mean this is bollicks, ey can't even collect me stock that're still down there."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"Look, I'm really thankful allright. But I need ye to install this gun and use it on the dron's outside my disillery."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"Then I'll get me stock back, And ye keep the gun."_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Brandons Buoy" />
<give item="Autogun Mk3"/>
<place-enemy dest="Brandons Buoy" enemy="Security Drone" loot="Shield Battery"/>
<place-enemy dest="Brandons" enemy="Rocket Drone" loot=""/>

<condition at-dest="Brandons Buoy"/>
<dialog>You are in an authorized area! Leave immediately!</dialog>

<remove-map-marker/>

<condition no-enemy-at-dest="Brandons"/>
<dialog>No more drones in sight.</dialog>

<remove-map-marker/>
<give credits="400"/>

quests.name: SS Thunder in Distress
quests.xml:
<condition state="space" at-dest="Outback A089" no-enemy-at-dest="Outback A089" />
<dialog model="Broken Sloop">_"Mayday, Mayday, Mayday. This is SS Thunder. We are badly damaged and leaking air. 2 jumps west of Outback A089. Two souls on board."_</dialog>
<dialog>A distress call.

A ship, the SS Thunder, need help.</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<mark-on-map dest="Ship in distress" />
<condition state="surface" at-dest="Ship in distress" trigger="SAVE CREW"/>
<give item="Crew of SS Thunder"/>
<dialog>_"Thank you! We lost our pilot and would surely have died if not for you.

We need to get to *Mirror Moon* at Pavonis. Can you take us there?"_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Mirror Moon" />
<condition at-dest="A1573"/>
<dialog>The crew from SS Thunder knock on the cockpit bulkhead.
_"Hey, Captain. No need to inform the police. A lot of hassle.
Just go to *Mirror Moon* and let us off."_</dialog>
<dialog>Hmm, that was suspicious...</dialog>
<condition not-have-item="Crew of SS Thunder"/>

quests.name: Help the crew of SS Thunder
quests.xml:
<condition state="surface" at-dest="Mirror Moon" have-item="Crew of SS Thunder" trigger="RELEASE CREW"/>
<dialog ok="RELEASE CREW" cancel="CANCEL">Release the crew of the SS Thunder? Maybe the police are interested in them?</dialog>
<dialog>_"Thank you! A true savior. Take this for your troubles, it might come in handy."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"We will disappear now, but you seem like a smart kid. If you are strapped for cash you should talk to Mr. Tall at *Pavonis Ember*."_</dialog>
<dialog>You got a reward, but you also have a feeling that maybe it wasn't the good guys who won this time.</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<give credits="1000"/>
<take item="Crew of SS Thunder" />
<mark-on-map dest="Pavonis Ember" />
<condition state="surface" at-dest="Pavonis Ember" trigger="ASK FOR MR. TALL"/>
<dialog>The operator at Ember Control Tower hails you. Instead of the usual greeting they just say:

_"Mr. Tall  is ready to see you."_</dialog>
<dialog>Two kids greet you outside the ship.
_"Mr. Tall says he is grateful for you helping his friends from the Thunder."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"Mr. Tall says you should help him more.

Here are letters. Mr. Tall want you to take them to *Bifrost*."_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Bifrost" />
<condition state="surface" at-dest="Bifrost" trigger="DELIVER LETTERS"/>
<dialog model="Space Elevator">
Three deckhands greet you as you enter Bifrost Station.
  
The shorter of the three approaches you.

_"Greetings, I am Mr. Tall"_
</dialog>
<dialog model="Space Elevator">
It is only separated from his companions you notice that he is at least 2 meters tall. His henchmen must be monstrous! You look over his shoulder.

_"Ah, my assistants. Mr. Left and Mr. Right are human, but not of woman born so to speak."_
</dialog>
<dialog model="Space Elevator">
_"But let us get on with business. I am grateful for the delivery and your compensation is being transferred as we speak. And I would be delighted if you could do yet another service for me."_
</dialog>
<give credits="700"/>
<dialog model="Space Elevator" ok="OK" cancel="NOT NOW">
_"This package must be placed in orbit around *Bregna*."_

_"Are you willing to help me?"_
</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Bregna" />
<condition at-dest="Bregna" trigger="PLACE PACKAGE" />
<dialog>You position the package in the precise orbit requested by Mr. Tall. A cumbersome way of transferring packages, it must contain something highly sensitive.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Bifrost" />

<condition at-dest="Bifrost" state="surface" trigger="REPORT TO MR. TALL" />
<dialog model="Space Elevator">
_"Excellent, excellent! My customers will pick up the parcel. Good work. And here, your compensation."_
</dialog>
<give credits="500"/>

<condition at-dest="Bifrost" state="surface" trigger="CONTACT MR. TALL" />
<dialog model="Space Elevator">
_"Ah, my dear friend. You have come at the right time."_

_"An previous partner of mine has turned out to, well, not be a friend."_
</dialog>
<dialog model="Space Elevator" ok="COUNT ON ME" cancel="NOT NOW">
_"Go to *Urd* and teach her a lesson."_

_"Any please don't leave a mess. Dump any leftover garbage, or escape pods, at *A4846*."_
</dialog>

<place-enemy dest="Urd" enemy="Bandit Striker" loot="Platinum"/>
<place-enemy dest="A4846" enemy="Bandit Striker" loot="Autogun Mk2"/>

<condition no-enemy-at-dest="Urd" />
<dialog model="Sphere">
The gangster that had fallen out of favor escapes in a pod from his burning ship.

Mindful of Mr. Tall's instructions you scoop up the pod and secure it in your hold.
</dialog>
<dialog model="Sphere">
You prefer to not travel around with that kind of cargo, best to drop it off at *A4846* as soon as possible.
</dialog>

<condition at-dest="A4846" state="surface" trigger="DROP POD" />
<dialog>As you approach the lonely asteroid your exhaust flame is reflected from the surface.

A forest of tiny twinkles. Hundreds of discarded escape pods litter the dark side of the rock!</dialog>
<dialog>You drop off one more pod and hurry away.</dialog>

<condition at-dest="Bifrost" state="surface" trigger="CONTACT MR. TALL" />
<dialog model="Space Elevator">
No one meet you this time. A scurrying courier robot stop and leave a message:

_"Well done with the cleaning. Compensation transferred."_
</dialog>
<dialog>You appreciate the hard cash, but you wonder what kind of business you have gotten yourself into. It apparently don't end well for everyone.</dialog>
<give credits="2000"/>

quests.name: Investigate the SS Thunder
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Pavonis Police" have-item="Crew of SS Thunder"/>
<dialog model="Tiendong Station">As you approach the police station they hail you.
_"Citizen, we are looking for any information as to the whereabouts of the SS Thunder. Hail us if you have seen anything."_</dialog>
<condition have-item="Crew of SS Thunder" at-dest="Pavonis Police" trigger="TURN IN CREW"/>
<dialog ok="TURN IN CREW" cancel="CANCEL">Turn in the crew of the SS Thunder to the police? They might have powerful friends.</dialog>
<take item="Crew of SS Thunder" />
<dialog model="Tiendong Station">The officers look astonished as you present them with the crew of the SS Thunder.

_"Wow, this was more than we hoped for!"_</dialog>
<dialog model="Tiendong Station">_"But to tell the truth we don't actually know what they have done.

They won't say a thing to us but we have seen a string of suspicious activity coinciding with the SS Thunder's path across the sector."_</dialog>
<dialog model="Tiendong Station" ok="OK" cancel="NOT RIGHT NOW">_"If we come storming in asking questions we won't get any answers. But a private investigator might...

Are you up for some undercover work?."_</dialog>
<dialog model="Tiendong Station">_"Investigate what happened to their ship. Any physical evidence that you can find. Someone at the nearby station - the *Black Stump* - must have seen something.

Ask around."_</dialog>
<give credits="100"/>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<mark-on-map dest="Ship in distress" />
<place-item dest="Ship in distress" item="Flight log"/>

<condition have-item="Flight log" />
<mark-on-map dest="Black Stump" />

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Black Stump" trigger="ASK QUESTIONS"/>
<dialog model="Hermit Home">You snoop around the station. The deckmen say the crew of the Thunder were really interested in the station's drones.</dialog>
<dialog>The Flight log says that they visited every destination that had a problem with a malfunctioning drone. They probably caused this whole mess.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Pavonis Police" />

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Pavonis Police" trigger="GIVE INFO"/>
<dialog model="Tiendong Station">_"Drone manipulation? That figures. We started digging into their backstories. They are agents trying to destabilize Pavonis. With the evidence you got we have a solid case."_</dialog>
<dialog model="Tiendong Station">_"Here is a state-mandated reward for your work. Thank you and safe travels."_</dialog>
<give credits="1000"/>

quests.name: Leave the Outback
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Outback A34" />
<dialog model="NS Vanguard">A Colonial Navy patrol craft is stationed at the asteroid.
_"Stop your engines Traveller. There are malfunctioning Striker Drones ahead. We guard here until reinforcements arrive."_</dialog>
<dialog>If they are Striker Drones they have shields that can withstand physical damage.

Perhaps *Samson* has a weapon that can take down the drones' shields.</dialog>
<hint layout="quest">Quest arrow now points to Samson's Folly</hint>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<mark-on-map dest="Samson's Folly" />
<place-inventory dest="Samson's Folly" item="Photon Ray"/>

<condition at-dest="Samson's Folly"/>
<dialog>You speak to Samson about the drones. She looks worried. But says she has something to sell you that might help.</dialog>

<condition have-item="Photon Ray" />
<hint layout="profile">Install your new weapon</hint>

<condition installed-item="Photon Ray" />
<hint layout="profile"></hint>
<mark-on-map dest="Buoy Outback 36" />
<condition no-enemy-at-dest="Buoy Outback 36" />
<dialog model="NS Vanguard">The Navy patrol slips past you once the area was cleared. They don't hail you, ashamed at being helped by a civilian.</dialog>

quests.name: Bandits in The Bush
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Black Stump"/>
<dialog model="Hermit Home">Black Stump station, you have heard of the place. Rough.
You listen in on their radio chatter.</dialog>
<dialog model="Hermit Home">_"... best booty in town. Say, did you hear about the SS Thunder that passed through here?"_
  
_"They got into some trouble. They told us they were tourists but if you ask me there was something fishy with their setup..."_</dialog>

<condition at-dest="Black Stump" trigger="HAIL STATION"/>
<dialog model="Hermit Home">_"Hey, traveller!"_
_"Welcome to Black Stump station. We have some problems with Bandits out here in The Bush right now. We can help you stock up on good equipment so they don't hassle you."_</dialog>
<dialog model="Hermit Home" ok="YES" cancel="NOT NOW">_"If you are short on cash the outpost on *Spruce* always pays good money for *Supplies*. Would you like to make a supply run?"_</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<give item="Supplies"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Spruce" />

<condition have-item="Supplies" at-dest="Spruce" />
<dialog ok="SELL" cancel="LEAVE">The small outpost on the surface of the planet hails you.

They ask if you have supplies they can buy.</dialog>
<take item="Supplies"/>
<give credits="100"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Black Stump" />

<condition at-dest="Black Stump"/>
<dialog model="Hermit Home">_"Good work with the supply run. A bit dangerous out there now with all the Bandits."_</dialog>
<dialog model="Hermit Home" ok="YES" cancel="NOT NOW">_"One of those bandits took out a transport headed here. It crashed on Pine, we are interested in any Supplies that might have survived. Can you help us?"_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Pine" />
<place-item dest="Pine" item="Supplies"/>

<condition have-item="Supplies"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Black Stump" />

<condition at-dest="Black Stump" have-item="Supplies" trigger="GIVE SUPPLIES"/>
<take item="Supplies"/>
<give credits="150"/>
<dialog model="Hermit Home">_"Excellent! These supplies are sorely needed out here in The Bush."_</dialog>
<dialog model="Hermit Home">_"If you want to take on the Bandits to the south you are going to need a better ship. Our *SHIPYARD* can help you."_</dialog>

quests.name: University Bulletin
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="The Bush Transfer Buoy"/>
<add-to-quest-list />
<dialog>This buoy is looping a bulletin broadcast.
`- Pavonis Smoke University is offering contract work.`
`- Pavonis Mining Corp is offering contract work.`</dialog>

quests.name: Trader Without a Cause
quests.xml:
<condition state="surface" at-dest="Bundeszone" trigger="HAIL TRADER"/>
<dialog model="Hermit Home">_"Welcome Traveller.
Our store is closed right now. The conflict forced the Sternrat to requisition our entire stock."_</dialog>
<dialog model="Hermit Home">_"We have a delivery incoming but it is stuck at *Tod Mond*."_</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<mark-on-map dest="Tod Mond" />

<condition at-dest="Tod Mond" trigger="SCAN FOR CARGO"/>
<dialog>The scanner sweeps across the region.
No sign of the trader's cargo at this moon.

But far north there are traces of a destroyed transport...</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Tod Debris" />

<condition at-dest="Tod Debris" trigger="SCAN FOR CARGO"/>
<dialog model="Debris">Death. Once a cargo ship. Now a smoldering carcass.
The Mimos did this.

In the breached cargo section the trader's crates sit. You take what you came for.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Bundeszone" />

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Bundeszone" trigger="GIVE CARGO"/>
<dialog model="Hermit Home">_"Amazing!
Please, take this reward. And buy here at a discount of course. Our inventory is now restored."_</dialog>
<give credits="2000" />
<place-inventory dest="Bundeszone" item="Nanite Attack;EMP Bomb;Gauss Gun;Phased Ray;Coronal Pulse;Locus Beam;Luminal Driver;Sc Disruptor;Metabomb;Railgun;Nucleon Ray;Aural Pulse;Apex Beam;Helix Driver;Au Disruptor"/>

quests.name: Outer Dusk Ranger
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Hafen Tracking Station" state="surface" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog ok="ENLIST" cancel="NOT NOW">_"Traveller, the war effort need help with tracking enemy movements in the *Outer Dusk*."_

_"Can we count on you?"_</dialog>
<dialog>_"Excellent!"_

_"Give *Beendung* and *Höhle* any support they require.
And look for any hidden Mimos bases or devices in the surrounding asteroids."_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Höhle" />
<add-to-quest-list />

<condition at-dest="Höhle" state="surface" trigger="REPORT TO HÖHLE"/>
<dialog>_"What? Are the federals sending us mercenaries instead of real military now?"_</dialog>
<dialog>You ignore their internal politics and ask if they need any help.</dialog>
<dialog>_"The Mimos make occasional forays into the Outer Dusk. We need help with these intrusions."_</dialog>

<condition at-dest="Höhle" state="surface" no-enemy-at-dest="A646;A823;Beendung" trigger="REPORT AREA CLEAR"/>
<dialog>You report that you have cleared the Outer Dusk of Mimos rangers.

_"Thank you! The intrusions must serve a purpose, they are hiding something out here..."_</dialog>

<condition at-dest="Höhle" state="surface" have-item="Mysterious Device" trigger="SHOW MYSTERIOUS DEVICE"/>
<dialog>_"Did you find that out there? It smells of the Mimos, must be their device."_

_"Wonder what that thing do? Surely nothing good."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"For being a mercenary, you did really well. Make sure to collect your payment at *Hafen Tracking Station*."_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Hafen Tracking Station" />
<condition at-dest="Hafen Tracking Station" state="surface" trigger="REPORT SUCCESS"/>
<dialog>You report that you cleared the Outer Dusk. The Hafen personel don't know what to make of the Mysterious Device but they take it and pay you handsomely.</dialog>
<give credits="400" />
<take item="Mysterious Device" />

quests.name: Bugging the Outer Dusk
quests.xml:
<condition state="surface" at-dest="Mimos Habitat" trigger="CONTACT MIMOS"/>
<dialog>`Mimos. Human.`
`Activate. Ruins. 3 Devices. Place *Splitter*. Place *Scherbe*. Place *Teil*.`</dialog>
<dialog>The don't attack you. Perhaps because you hailed them first. They seem to be giving instructions. You radio a question back.</dialog>
<dialog>`3 Devices. *Ruins*. Activate. Friend. Not weapon. Not harm.`</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<mark-on-map dest="Splitter" />
<give item="Mysterious Device"/>
<give item="Mysterious Device"/>
<give item="Mysterious Device"/>

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Splitter" trigger="PLACE DEVICE"/>
<take item="Mysterious Device"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Scherbe" />

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Scherbe" trigger="PLACE DEVICE"/>
<take item="Mysterious Device"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Teil" />

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Teil" trigger="PLACE DEVICE"/>
<take item="Mysterious Device"/>

<mark-on-map dest="Mimos Ruins" />

<condition at-dest="Mimos Ruins" />
<dialog model="Ruin">As you approach the ruins you see that something has happened to them.

Or is happening.

They seem to live.</dialog>
<dialog model="Ruin">The devices you have places have activated the Mimos Ruins.
Changing. Repairing.
They are becoming something.</dialog>
<dialog model="Ruin">The interior of the ruin starts to shimmer and shift.
From inside the structure Mimos ships emerge. The space rippling like water as they materialize one after another.</dialog>
<dialog>They are not warships. They are something else.

`Friend. Mimos. Peace Sternrat. Peace Mimos. *Tell Sternrat Station*.`</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Sternrat Station" />

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Sternrat Station" trigger="MEDIATE PEACE"/>
<dialog>The senators at Sternrat Stations are not happy. They see the Mimos as aggressors, and you as a traitor for opening the gate.

But they also see the Mimos peacefully waiting for a response.</dialog>
<dialog>The senate at Sternrat Stations send an envoy. A diplomatic mission. They dismiss you. Give their thanks privately, wary of the political ramifications of embracing your actions if the peace falters.</dialog>

<dialog>You, a mediator. And here, perhaps peace.</dialog>

quests.name: Sternrat Blockade
quests.xml:
<condition state="space" at-dest="Staub Trojan" />
<dialog model="Ursula">A ship hails you.</dialog>
<dialog model="Ursula">_"Traveller!
You have come to our area in a time of great peril. The Mimos are trying to break through!

If you want to help us in the fight go to *Sternrat Station*"_</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<mark-on-map dest="Sternrat Station" />

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Sternrat Station" trigger="HAIL STATION"/>
<dialog model="Sternrat Station">The operator you speak to at Sternrat Station makes it clear that there is a war going on.

The Mimos have breached through into Sternbund space.</dialog>
<dialog model="Sternrat Station">They say that a patrol has cornered a Mimos Dart at *Dunkel Mond* and need help.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Dunkel Trojan" />
<place-enemy dest="Dunkel Trojan" enemy="Mimos Dart"/>

<condition no-enemy-at-dest="Dunkel Trojan" />
<dialog>The cornered Mimos succumbs to your attack. *Sternrat Station* will be pleased.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Sternrat Station" />

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Sternrat Station" trigger="REPORT VICTORY"/>
<dialog>_"Thank you! We need all soldiers we can get. The goal is to quell the Mimos at the source, deep in their cloud banks."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"The charter forbids weapons here at Sternrat Station, but the trader at *Bundeszone* has a full assortment."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"When you are prepared, join the fight and bring down the Mimos!"_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Mimos Habitat" />

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Mimos Aperture" trigger="ANALYZE APERTURE"/>
<dialog model="Larato Gate">The structure appears to be a portal. But you are denied access. The Mimos markings clearly show the portal's origin.

There might be a way to access this portal...</dialog>
<place-item dest="Mimos Ruins" item="Mimos Key"/>

<condition at-dest="Mimos Ruins" />
<dialog model="Ruin">These old ruins share the same Mimosian markings as the portal you found earlier.</dialog>

quests.name: Mimos Aperture
quests.xml:
<mark id="jump_ready"/>
<condition have-item="Mimos Key" at-dest="Mimos Aperture" trigger="UNLOCK APERTURE"/>
<travel dest="Mimos Gate" />
<goto mark="jump_ready"/>

quests.name: Mimos Gate
quests.xml:
<mark id="jump_ready"/>
<condition have-item="Mimos Key" at-dest="Mimos Gate" trigger="UNLOCK GATE"/>
<travel dest="Mimos Aperture" />
<goto mark="jump_ready"/>

quests.name: Bal Gru's stolen subsystems
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Pizbui" />
<dialog model="Kerr Clipper">A ship orbiting the planet is sending a distress signal.</dialog>
<condition at-dest="Pizbui" trigger="HAIL SHIP"/>
<dialog ok="YES" cancel="NOT NOW" model="Kerr Clipper">
_"Hey, traveller! I'm Bal Gru, merchant in distress. Can you help me? Bandits robbed me of all of my subsystems. Can you get them back for me?"_
</dialog>
<place-enemy dest="A3639" enemy="Bandit" loot="Subsystem cache"/>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<mark-on-map dest="A3639" />
<condition have-item="Subsystem cache"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Pizbui" />
<condition at-dest="Pizbui" have-item="Subsystem cache"/>
<dialog>
_"You have our stolen subsystems! This is invaluable to us. Here, take this artifact, it is the least we can give you."_
</dialog>
<give item="Larato sigil"/>
<take item="Subsystem cache"/>

quests.name: Beggars at Aldo Nova
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Lij" state="surface" />

<dialog>
	A peculiar, but still kind of friendly character approaches you.

	_"Can you help me with a simple task stranger? Go to the planet *Aldo Nova* and bring me a *strange item* and you will get greatly rewarded."_
</dialog>

<mark-on-map dest="Aldo Nova" />
<condition at-dest="Aldo Nova" state="surface" />

<dialog>
	A skinny old man greets you.

	_"What brings you to to this miserable place, we were so great once..."_
</dialog>

<condition at-dest="Aldo Nova" state="surface" trigger="SEARCH"/>

<dialog>After some intense digging you find a chip with 2 credits.</dialog>

<give credits="2" />

<condition at-dest="Aldo Nova" state="surface" trigger="CONTINUE SEARCH"/>

<dialog>
	You find an old destroyed harvester.

	You ask yourself, how can this be of a value, and removes whats intact. 
	One part stands out and the rocket-like item seems like it could be the *strange item*.
</dialog>

<mark-on-map dest="Lij" />
<condition at-dest="Lij" state="surface" trigger="DELIVER ITEM" />

<dialog>
	_"I am impressed! Very well done."_

	_"And as per our agreement, here is a reward."_
</dialog>

<give item="Green Seed" />

<dialog>
	The man hands over a single green furry seed.
	As you glare at him he smiles.

	_"It might be worthless to you and me, but go to *Aldo Nova* and you might be surprised."_
</dialog>
<dialog>
	You feel defeated but decide to trust the strange man. You don't have much to loose anyhow, it is clear he will not give you any riches.
</dialog>

<mark-on-map dest="Aldo Nova" />
<condition at-dest="Aldo Nova" state="surface" trigger="VISIT VILLAGE" />

<dialog>
	You arrive quietly to a deserted smaller settlement.

	_"Hello foreigner, could you spare a credit, or something more suitable, anything is better that nothing?"_
</dialog>
<dialog>
	_"Do you have anything that grows? We once had such sumptuous forests here."_

	Hmm, you have the ugly seed that you got as a reward.
</dialog>

<condition at-dest="Aldo Nova" state="surface" trigger="GIVE SEED" />

<dialog>
	You give them the strange item you found. They get very excited!

	_"Thank you! This is a amazing gift."_
</dialog>
<dialog>
  You stay a few days and get to see how the villages get the seed to sprout. And how they prepare for the coming of a new golden age for this planet.
</dialog>

quests.name: Larato Gate
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Larato Node" have-item="Larato sigil" />
<mark-on-map dest="Larato Node" />
<mark id="ready_for_jump" />
<condition at-dest="Larato Node" have-item="Larato sigil" trigger="ACTIVATE PORTAL" />
<dialog model="Larato Gate" ok="ENTER GATE" cancel="LEAVE">
The misty dark cloud in the aperture swirls.
</dialog>
<travel dest="Larato Gate"/>
<goto mark="ready_for_jump" />

quests.name: Deluvian Tablet
quests.xml:
<condition have-item="Deluvian Tablet" />
<take item="Deluvian Tablet"/>
<dialog>The signal source leads to ancient ruins that reveal stone tablets filled with inscriptions.</dialog>
<dialog model="Tablet">_These inscriptions are our legacy. Our last exodus ship has left, we that remain have sealed our fate._</dialog>
<dialog model="Tablet">_Our society was a peaceful one, and it ended when our oceans dried up. Drop by drop the Scourge stole them. Unstoppable, they siphoned it from our planet._</dialog>
<dialog model="Tablet">_Deep in the Pio mountains we will now go to store our knowledge._</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list />
<condition state="surface" at-dest="Obria" trigger="SEARCH FOR TABLETS"/>
<place-item dest="Obria" item="Deluvian Tablet" />
<condition have-item="Deluvian Tablet"/>
<take item="Deluvian Tablet"/>
<dialog model="Tablet">_Ahead of our fleets we send probes. Their task is to pave the way, find planets and turn dry worlds into oceans. To make preparations for our survival._</dialog>
<dialog model="Tablet">_The first exodus ship left a full generation ago. That ship went past The Great Star, to the other side of this Expanse._</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Fatos" />
<condition state="surface" at-dest="Fatos" trigger="SEARCH FOR TABLETS"/>
<place-item dest="Fatos" item="Deluvian Tablet" />
<condition have-item="Deluvian Tablet"/>
<take item="Deluvian Tablet"/>
<dialog model="Tablet">_Our probes must have failed, this is a dry world. We could stay and complete the work of the probes, but we must press on. For our worst fears have been made reality._
_The Scourge are following us._</dialog>
<dialog model="Tablet">_We leave this tablet here as a marker for others. As warning. We hope we will find a safe haven near the bright blue star._</dialog>
<dialog>_To cross The Great Void means we must construct a sacred aperture, and make a Great Jump._

_It is our hope that the Scourge will not follow us across the Void._</dialog>

quests.name: Deluvian Marker
quests.xml:
<condition have-item="Deluvian Marker" />
<take item="Deluvian Marker"/>
<dialog>Among crumbling ruins an alien marker stands, its surface covered with inscriptions.</dialog>
<dialog model="Tablet">_Our exodus through the sacred apertures led  us here. Our new homeworld. Our haven._

_This time we did not flee again when the Scourge finally found us._</dialog>
<dialog model="Tablet">_How the Scourge could travel across The Great Void is a mystery. It took them generations, but of such things the mindless Scourge care little._</dialog>
<dialog model="Tablet">_A myriad of tiny specks, the formless Scourge are like gnats. They seem unbeatable. This will be our last stand._</dialog>

quests.name: Expanse Archeology
quests.xml:
<condition state="surface" at-dest="Zealou Workshops" trigger="HAIL STATION"/>
<dialog>A weak signal from one of the docked ships is broadcasting a call for freelancer.

`Assignment available. Historians needed.`</dialog>
<condition state="surface" at-dest="Zealou Workshops" trigger="HAIL SHIP"/>
<dialog model="Helyon Shipyards">
_"Finally! An answer to out bulletin."_
_"I am from the Archeology Institution and we will pay good credits for help in excavations of the Al Se Expanse"_
</dialog>
<dialog model="Helyon Shipyards" ok="OK" cancel="MAYBE LATER">
_"Are you willing to help us? Look for *Alien Relics* that might be present on planets in the *Al Se Expanse*. Unknown exactly where."_
</dialog>
<place-item item="Alien Relic" dest="Mammon"/>
<place-item item="Alien Relic" dest="Grig"/>
<place-item item="Alien Relic" dest="Ko"/>
<condition state="surface" have-item="Alien Relic" at-dest="Zealou Workshops" trigger="DELIVER ALIEN RELIC"/>
<take item="Alien Relic" />
<dialog>_"Good work. Please, there might be more out there."_</dialog>
<condition state="surface" have-item="Alien Relic" at-dest="Zealou Workshops" trigger="DELIVER ALIEN RELIC"/>
<take item="Alien Relic" />
<dialog>_"Excellent work. Please, there might be more out there."_</dialog>
<condition state="surface" have-item="Alien Relic" at-dest="Zealou Workshops" trigger="DELIVER ALIEN RELIC"/>
<take item="Alien Relic" />
<dialog>_"Fantastic work. This is enough for several years of research. Please, accept this compensation."_</dialog>
<give credits="1200"/>

quests.name: Larato Node
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Larato Gate" have-item="Larato sigil" />
<mark-on-map dest="Larato Gate" />
<condition at-dest="Larato Gate" have-item="Larato sigil" trigger="ANALYZE"/>
<dialog model="Larato Gate" ok="APPROACH" cancel="IGNORE">
The Larato Gate is a ring of dirty stone needles. The Larato Sigil in your inventory is humming.
Should you approach?
</dialog>
<dialog model="Larato Gate">
The gate's mass of needles swells and twitches. The aperture shimmers and turns into a misty black cloud.
</dialog>
<mark id="ready_for_jump" />
<condition at-dest="Larato Gate" trigger="ACTIVATE PORTAL"/>
<dialog model="Larato Gate" ok="ENTER GATE" cancel="LEAVE">
The misty dark cloud in the aperture swirls.
</dialog>
<travel dest="Larato Node"/>
<goto mark="ready_for_jump" />

quests.name: Blue seeds
quests.xml:
<place-item dest="Blue Forest" item="Blue seeds"/>
<condition have-item="Blue seeds"/>
<dialog model="Seeds">These Blue Seeds might take root in the right soil.</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<condition at-dest="Blue Ocean" state="surface" trigger="PLANT SEEDS"/>
<dialog model="Seeds">You plant the Blue Seeds on a lonely island.</dialog>
<condition at-dest="Blue Ocean" state="surface" trigger="GATHER FLOWERS"/>
<dialog model="Flowers">You gather the Blue Flowers that sprung out of the planted seeds.</dialog>
<give item="Blue flowers"/>
<condition at-dest="Buoy 187" />
<dialog model="Flowers">The flowers fill the cabin with a fragrant smell. Soothing.
But suddenly you grow dizzy, intoxicated. Your vision blurs as your work the ships controls in a stupor. _Darkness!_</dialog>
<travel dest="Anomaly 2050"/>
<condition at-dest="Anomaly 2050" />
<dialog model="Junk">You wake up. _Horror!_ While drugged you must have overridden the safeties and made an unguided jump. Extremely dangerous. The ship got an emergency lock on some nearby debris and exited the jump.</dialog>
<condition at-dest="Som Thia" trigger="INVESTIGATE" />
<dialog model="Alien Buoy">In orbit around the planet, you find ancient relics. They seem to contain jump coordinates. With them, you might dare to make another far jump back from this dead end.</dialog>
<dialog>With the *Soma Jump Coords*, you should now be able to make Long Jumps between *Buoy 187* and *Anomaly 2050*.</dialog>
<give item="Soma Jump Coords" />
<mark-on-map dest="Anomaly 2050" />
<condition at-dest="Anomaly 2050" have-item="Soma Jump Coords" />

quests.name: Soma Long Jump
quests.xml:
<condition have-item="Soma Jump Coords" />
<mark-on-map dest="Buoy 187" />
<mark id="ready_for_jump" />
<condition at-dest="Anomaly 2050" have-item="Soma Jump Coords" trigger="LONG JUMP" />
<travel dest="Buoy 187"/>
<goto mark="ready_for_jump" />

quests.name: Soma Return Jump
quests.xml:
<condition have-item="Soma Jump Coords" />
<mark-on-map dest="Anomaly 2050" />
<mark id="ready_for_jump" />
<condition at-dest="Buoy 187" have-item="Soma Jump Coords" trigger="LONG JUMP" />
<travel dest="Anomaly 2050"/>
<goto mark="ready_for_jump" />

quests.name: First Contact
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Alien Reception" />
<dialog>The star ahead of you is Beryl Canis. The home of the Soma. A star that no one has visited, the Soma block all jump paths to their home.</dialog>
<dialog model="Alien Meetup">Around the alien buoy, a Soma ship is parked. It does not attack you, perhaps you can approach and try to hail it.</dialog>

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Alien Reception" trigger="HAIL ALIENS"/>
<dialog model="Alien Meetup">_"Visitor. Starfarer! Many Soma are suspicious. And some are welcoming. Visitors should be careful."_</dialog>
<dialog model="Alien Meetup">_"You have dealt with the Blue Seeds and Flowers. Be very careful with those. Bring us *Blue Seeds* from the asteroids to the south and we will vouch for you."_</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<mark-on-map dest="A9725" />
<place-item dest="A9725" item="Blue seeds" />

<condition have-item="Blue seeds" at-dest="A9725"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Alien Reception" />

<condition state="surface" have-item="Blue seeds" at-dest="Alien Reception" trigger="GIVE SEEDS"/>
<dialog model="Alien Meetup">_"The Soma is grateful. The blue flowers grow and multiply. A cycle. But if a flower is nurtured by us, it will branch that cycle and spawn a Soma."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"Go to our homeworld. We will spread the word our friendship. Some will distrust you, but many more will welcome you."_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Soma" />

<condition state="space" at-dest="Soma" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog>You send a message toward the planet. The supposed homeworld of the Soma.
Up until now you almost doubted the stories of their race, and now you are the first human to visit this system.</dialog>
<dialog>_"Starfarer. We hear you are a friend.
We propose an exchange, a trade as you call it. Go to *Beryl Canis Lookout* and gather the *Essence*."_</dialog>
<dialog>Up until now the communication with these aliens have been surprisingly smooth. But now you feel confused.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Beryl Canis Lookout" />
<place-item dest="Beryl Canis Lookout" item="Soma Essence"/>

<condition have-item="Soma Essence" />
<dialog>The "Essence" is apparently some sort of data storage. Maybe. You are not sure. Now back to *Soma* to *land* and hand it over.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Soma" />

<condition state="surface" have-item="Soma Essence" at-dest="Soma" trigger="GIVE ESSENCE"/>
<dialog>Hesitantly a small drone approaches you. It accepts the Essence and hurries away. The Soma are shy. You hear nothing on the radio. Confused you go back to the ship.</dialog>
<dialog>In the cargo hold, a new item sits. How they managed to deliver it is a mystery. One that you don't intend to investigate.</dialog>
<give item="Aegis Inducer"/>

quests.name: Milking Whales
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Som Phtia" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog>_"We Soma have worshipped the Cosmic Whales for generations. But we cannot approach them. A visitor however can. Be a friend of Soma and find the elusive *Cosmic Whales*. Find them and bring us their milk."_</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Cosmic Whales" trigger="MILK"/>
<dialog model="Cosmic Whales">The graceful creatures excrete a white liquid that form a glittering trail in space. Probably nothing to do with milk but you collect it anyway.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Som Phtia" />

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Som Phtia" trigger="GIVE MILK"/>
<dialog>_"This milk is surely a prize. The visitor is truly a friend of Soma."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"Whales thrive around the blue Soma sun. But they are not from here. Far to the south are whales that give an even thicker milk. We will mark the grazing grounds for you. Go there!"_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Grazing Cosmic Whales" />

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Grazing Cosmic Whales" trigger="MILK"/>
<dialog model="Cosmic Whales">Majestic creatures. You carefully collect their milk as they swim in the stellar breeze.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Som Phtia" />

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Som Phtia" trigger="GIVE MILK"/>
<dialog>_"Soma are forever grateful. Wait here while we skim the milk."_</dialog>

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Som Phtia" trigger="COLLECT CREAM"/>
<dialog>The Soma don't answer you directly. Silently they send a drone that deliver a thick white liquid to your ship.</dialog>
<dialog>_"Friend! Let the cream bake in the hotness of the Soma Sun. Go to the *Lookout* as generations of Soma has done."_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Beryl Canis Lookout" />

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Beryl Canis Lookout" trigger="BAKE MILK"/>
<dialog>The Soma are peculiar. This substance and this process have hardly anything in common with milk. But that is how they consistently translate it.</dialog>
<dialog model="Observatory">Scalding heat from Beryl Canis roast your hull, but also bake the mysterious white "cream" into something new.</dialog>
<give item="Whale Cheese"/>

quests.name: Soma Isolationists
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Soma Isolationist Gate" />
<dialog>*Alarms scream!*
A probe is racing towards you and passes you at tremendous speed. It is a messenger.</dialog>
<dialog>_"Visitor. The Opener Soma have invited you. We, Isolator Soma, will defend our space from corruption."_</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>

<condition dest="A100" no-enemy-at-dest="A100"/>
<dialog>_"Visitor. We do not oppose you. We will only protect our space."_</dialog>

<condition dest="A381" no-enemy-at-dest="A381"/>
<dialog>_"Visitor. We do not oppose you. We will only protect our space."_</dialog>

<condition at-dest="Som Yrri"/>
<dialog>Soma ships are orbiting the planet. They do not attack you.</dialog>

<condition at-dest="Som Yrri" trigger="HAIL SOMA"/>
<dialog>_"We Isolators do not agree with the Openers. Soma preservation is paramount.

However, you are not our enemy. The Openers caused a greater danger. They caused the Gnats."_</dialog>
<dialog ok="I WILL DO IT" cancel="I'M AFRAID">_"We Isolators do not embrace you. But you are skilled. Go to the depths of the Gnat infestation. Stop them."_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Gnat Ground Zero" />

<condition at-dest="Gnat Ground Zero" no-enemy-at-dest="Gnat Ground Zero"/>
<dialog>The Isolator Soma gave you a tool. An information poison. *INSPECT* the *Ground Zero* and release it.</dialog>

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Gnat Ground Zero" no-enemy-at-dest="Gnat Ground Zero" trigger="POISON"/>
<dialog>As the poison reaches the ruins of the Gnat disaster the effects are spectacular. Out of every crack and pore, tiny Gnats pour out, smoking and crumbling as they perish.</dialog>
<dialog>You should return to *Som Yrri*. Tell them that the work is done.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Som Yrri" />

<condition at-dest="Som Yrri" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog ok="I WILL DO IT" cancel="THIS IS NOT MY PROBLEM">_"The Gnats are truly monstrous. The Openers let them into our system as they opened the portals.

We must talk the Openers.
Take our ambassador to Beryl Canis I."_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Beryl Canis I" />

<condition at-dest="Beryl Canis I" trigger="LEAVE AMBASSADOR"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Soma" />
<dialog>_"We will wait here on this neutral ground. Bring an envoy from *Soma*."_</dialog>

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Soma" trigger="GET ENVOY"/>
<dialog>You don't get any response when you over radio tell the Soma that the splinter group Isolator is waiting for peace talks at *Beryl Canis I*.
After a long silence, a single Soma ship approaches you.</dialog>
<dialog>_"We will talk. Escort us."_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Beryl Canis I" />

<condition at-dest="Beryl Canis I" trigger="LEAVE ENVOY"/>
<dialog>The representatives of the two factions meet out of sight of your visitor's eyes.
But they return almost immediately.</dialog>
<dialog ok="OF COURSE" cancel="NOT NOW">_"We have an agreement. You freed us from the Gnat danger. You are trusted.
The Soma system will remain closed to other humans. But an ambassador will be established at *Pavonis Ember*. Take us there."_</dialog>
<give item="Soma Ambassador"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Pavonis Ember" />

<condition state="surface" have-item="Soma Ambassador" at-dest="Pavonis Ember" trigger="LEAVE AMBASSADOR"/>
<dialog>You sense both fear and excitement. The mythical Soma suddenly opening up. Visiting a human world. A new beginning.</dialog>
<take item="Soma Ambassador"/>

quests.name: Eye of the Needle
quests.xml:
<condition state="space" at-dest="Needle Gate" trigger="ENTER GATE"/>
<travel dest="Needle Relay A"/>
<condition at-dest="Needle Relay A"/>
<travel dest="Needle Port"/>
<condition state="surface" at-dest="Soma Generation Ship" trigger="EXPLORE DERELICT"/>
<dialog model="Soma Generation Ship">It is an ancient vessel. Built by the Soma long before they had jump drives.

It took their race all the way out here. But it is empty now. As is this place.</dialog>
<dialog model="Needle Gate">It stopped by this mysterious Needle Gate. Perhaps this is where the Gnats came from.

Perhaps it wasn't the Openers that let the Gnats in. Perhaps they opened the doors themselves.</dialog>
<dialog model="Soma Generation Ship">You search the enormous vessel. From some records and sculptures, you deduce that this great ship fell prey to the Gnats. In some way.
Since then the Gnats must have been searching for the Soma homeworld.</dialog>
<condition state="space" at-dest="Needle Port" trigger="ENTER GATE"/>
<travel dest="Needle Relay A"/>
<condition at-dest="Needle Relay A"/>
<travel dest="Needle Gate"/>

quests.name: Rebuild the Thanatos
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Thanatos" trigger="EXPLORE DERELICT"/>
<dialog model="Thanatos">It is the Thanatos derelict. Immensely old. Broken. The intact half is covered in cuneiform markings.</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>

<condition have-item="Thanatos mesh;Thanatos core;Thanatos nacelle"/>
<dialog>You now possess all three missing pieces of the Thanatos.</dialog>

<condition at-dest="Thanatos" trigger="REBUILD"/>
<dialog model="Thanatos" ok="REBUILD THANATOS" cancel="LEAVE">The relics would restore the form of Thanatos.</dialog>
<take item="Thanatos mesh;Thanatos core;Thanatos nacelle"/>
<dialog model="Thanatos">As the parts touch the derelict the edges melt and merge. In an instant the dead ship springs to life, fire dancing across its hull as it burns away the dust covering it.</dialog>
<dialog model="Sphere">The radio warbles as it is flooded with signals. A single grey sphere emerges from the ship and drifts toward you.</dialog>
<dialog model="Sphere">Touching the sphere cause tiny ripples of light on its surface. It whispers the name *Momus* into your mind.</dialog>
<give item="Momus"/>

quests.name: Thanatos relic 1
quests.xml:
<condition have-item="Thanatos mesh"/>
<dialog>You found a relic, a machine part covered with cuneiform markings.</dialog>

quests.name: Thanatos relic 2
quests.xml:
<condition have-item="Thanatos core"/>
<dialog>You found a relic, a machine part covered with cuneiform markings.</dialog>

quests.name: Thanatos relic 3
quests.xml:
<condition have-item="Thanatos nacelle"/>
<dialog>You found a relic, a machine part covered with cuneiform markings.</dialog>

quests.name: Worship the Apate
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Path to Apate"/>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<dialog model="Temple of Apate">An ancient derelict, *The Temple of Apate*, appear on the sensors ahead. It might contain riches. Or salvation.</dialog>
<condition no-enemy-at-dest="Threshold of the Temple;Stepstone of the Temple;Marker of the Temple"/>
<dialog>As the final sentinel is destroyed it send a subspace signal. Most probably the Temple heard its death cry.

Could be good, could be bad.</dialog>
<condition at-dest="Temple of Apate"/>
<dialog model="Temple of Apate">The temple is open now. The clearing of the sentinels must have unlocked it.</dialog>
<condition at-dest="Temple of Apate" trigger="ENTER TEMPLE"/>
<dialog model="Temple of Apate">Your vessel enters the open gate of the Temple. As you slowly sink deeper your sensors flicker and give up, one after another. The readings from the Temple is much too strange for the sensors to cope with.</dialog>
<dialog model="Sphere">Your ship dark as the last subsystem give up. Silently you drift into a central chamber.

Out of a central pillar, a dark sphere emerges. _A gift._</dialog>
<dialog model="Sphere">You retrieve the artifact from the pillar. As you touch it, it whispers the name *Horkos* into your mind.</dialog>
<give item="Horkos"/>

quests.name: Navigate the Eris
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Gateway of Eris"/>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<dialog>A dusty nebula spread out in front of you. The dirty fields of Eris.</dialog>
<condition at-dest="Locus of Eris" have-item="Eris Shard;Eris Dust;Eris Splinter;Eris Grain"/>
<dialog ok="GIVE GIFTS" cancel="LEAVE">Something stirs in the Locus of Eris. It reacts to something you carry.</dialog>
<take item="Eris Shard"/>
<take item="Eris Dust"/>
<take item="Eris Splinter"/>
<take item="Eris Grain"/>
<dialog>You place the artifacts of Eris on the dusty sands of the Locus. They sink into the drifting dunes. In their place a shiny cube emerges, spreading a dazzling light.</dialog>
<dialog>The cube unfolds slowly to reveal a dirty, lumpy rock. It drifts into your ship, leaving dark dirty marks on every surface it touches. It whispers its name - *Epiales* - into your mind.</dialog>
<give item="Epiales"/>

quests.name: Ska Ska water quality
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Baola" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog ok="YES" cancel="MAYBE LATER">_"Can you help us? We run a large construction project at Ska Ska and need to take water samples at its sea"_</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<mark-on-map dest="Ska Ska"/>
<place-item dest="Ska Ska" item="Water sample"/>
<condition have-item="Water sample"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Baola" />
<condition at-dest="Baola" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog>_"Thank you! These samples are vital for the project. Please, accept this compensation"_</dialog>
<take item="Water sample" />
<give credits="100"/>
<dialog>_"We are happy with your work, check back here later if you are looking for assignments."_</dialog>
<condition at-dest="Grig"/>
<condition at-dest="Baola" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog>_"Traveller!
The water samples you took revealed a serious contamination at Ska Ska."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"We need you go get a shipment of *DecontamiNanites* at *Helyon Shipyards*. Then go to *Ska Ska* and decontaminate the site."_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Helyon Shipyards" />
<place-inventory dest="Helyon Shipyards" item="DecontamiNanites"/>
<condition have-item="DecontamiNanites" />
<mark-on-map dest="Ska Ska" />
<dialog>You got the decontamination substance. Nanomachinery, dangerous stuff.</dialog>
<condition have-item="DecontamiNanites" at-dest="Ska Ska" trigger="DECONTAMINATE"/>
<take item="DecontamiNanites" />
<dialog>You launch the self-guiding pods with the nanite substance toward the construction site. The only thing left is to collect the pay at *Baola*.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Baola" color="F00" icon="chevrons"/>
<condition at-dest="Baola" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog>_"Traveller, we have a problem. Out security drones around Ska Ska have mistakenly identified the nanite decontaminant as an aggressor. They are jamming our channels."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"You must disable the confused drones so we can send control signals to the nanites."_</dialog>
<place-enemy dest="Ska Ska" enemy="Security Drone"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Ska Ska" />
<condition no-enemy-at-dest="Ska Ska" />
<dialog>As the Security Drone is disabled the jamming field is lowered. Now Baola can send control signals to the nanite swarm.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Baola" />
<condition at-dest="Baola" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog>_"Excellent fighting! All brawn and ... well - we are impressed.
Here is your reward. We have sent the security override codes. Ska Ska should be clean as a whistle in a jiffy."_</dialog>
<give credits="200" />
<dialog>You tense up. Something about 'security override codes' sound a bit dubious...</dialog>
<dialog>_"Oh no! The nanites have gone rampant, they are absorbing matter and forming some kind of mobile structure. What is happening?! You must save us!"_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Ska Ska" />
<place-enemy dest="Ska Ska" enemy="Nanite Megacluster" />
<condition no-enemy-at-dest="Ska Ska" />
<dialog>_"Thank you! You stopped that monstrosity from wreaking havoc. We can offer you this: an improved reactor from one of our ConstructoBots.
Out site at Ska Ska is a mess after this but work continues."_</dialog>
<give item="Mk4 Reactor"/>
<give credits="200" />

quests.name: Tau Pavonis Observer
quests.xml:
<mark-on-map dest="Pavonis Smoke" />
<condition at-dest="Pavonis Smoke"/>
<remove-map-marker/>
<dialog>You are hailed as you enter orbit: _"Traveller. Welcome to Pavonis Smoke, the leading university of the sector. Hail us if you are interested in contract work."_</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<mark-on-map dest="Pavonis Smoke"/>

<condition at-dest="Pavonis Smoke" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog ok="ACCEPT" cancel="NOT NOW">_"We study Tau Pavonis and need assistance in placing sensors at the *Observatory*. Compensation is 1000 credits. Are you interested?"_</dialog>
<dialog>_"First you need protection. Travel to *Pavonis Mirror* and acquire a *Star Shield*."_</dialog>
<give item="Star Sensor"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Pavonis Mirror"/>

<condition at-dest="Pavonis Mirror"/>
<dialog>_"Traveller. This is Mirror spaceport. We have prepared the *Star Shield* you will need. A drone will transfer it immediately, install it and hail us when you are ready to proceed."_</dialog>
<give item="Star Shield"/>

<condition state="space" at-dest="Pavonis Mirror" have-item="Star Sensor" installed-item="Star Shield" trigger="READY TO GO"/>
<dialog ok="PROCEED" cancel="WAIT">The heavy shield turns your ship into a sluggish barge. Are you ready to proceed down toward the fiery star?</dialog>
<travel dest="Pavonis Observatory"/>

<condition at-dest="Pavonis Observatory" trigger="PUT SENSOR"/>
<take item="Star Sensor" />
<dialog model="Sol Array">You don't understand how the delicate Star Sensor will withstand the scalding radiation but you install it as requested.</dialog>

<condition at-dest="Pavonis Observatory" trigger="LEAVE"/>
<travel dest="Pavonis Mirror"/>
<dialog>_"You made it! Must be a sturdy ship you got there."_</dialog>
<dialog>Did they send me on a suicide mission? That must be why they hired someone outside of their organization.</dialog>
<dialog>_"Let us remove that Star Shield, you can collect your payment at *Pavonis Smoke*."_</dialog>
<take item="Star Shield"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Pavonis Smoke"/>

<condition at-dest="Pavonis Smoke" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog>_"You survived! Excellent, we are anxious to get the data from the sensor. Please accept our payment!"_</dialog>
<give credits="1000"/>
<remove-map-marker/>

<condition not-at-dest="Pavonis Smoke"/>
<condition at-dest="Pavonis Smoke"/>
<dialog>_"Traveller! You helped us install the Star Sensor at Pavonis Observatory. The readings from that sensor are most disturbing. Tau Pavonis is behaving unphysically."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"You must help us collect more data! Please take us to the *Observatory* so we can make further readings."_</dialog>
<dialog>This time you request a much larger reward than last time, reminding them that they failed to mention the danger of the last mission.</dialog>
<dialog>_"Our resources are stretched thin, but this mission is critical! Tau Pavonis contains... something. We can offer you the experimental *Shield Reactor*. Ok?"_</dialog>
<dialog>You see an opportunity to make demands.
_"That sounds useful, give it to me in advance, and a regular reward afterward!"_</dialog>
<give item="Dermal Inducer"/>

<condition at-dest="Pavonis Mirror"/>
<dialog>They load the *Star Shield* onto your ship once again. They tell you to *install* it but they all look a bit worried this time. What is it they have found inside that star?</dialog>
<give item="Star Shield"/>

<condition state="space" at-dest="Pavonis Mirror" installed-item="Star Shield" trigger="READY TO GO"/>
<travel dest="Pavonis Observatory"/>
<dialog>The scientists take readings with their arcane instruments.
But you don't need any telescopes. Just looking through the dimmed windows you can see a region of the star's surface pulsing. Or heaving, as if breathing.</dialog>
<dialog model="Worm">Suddenly the star's surface opens like a flower and something break free from the open wound. It trashes like a wounded animal. It looks slow like a ballet, but at this scale, it is tremendously fast.</dialog>
<dialog>The monstrosity accelerates and traces a glowing path. South. Toward *Charm*. You decide to not press the scientists for that extra reward. This system got bigger problems to deal with now.</dialog>
<place-enemy enemy="Worm" dest="Charm"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Charm"/>

<condition at-dest="Pavonis Observatory" trigger="LEAVE" />
<travel dest="Pavonis Mirror" />
<take item="Star Shield" />

<condition at-dest="A117"/>
<dialog model="Worm">Your sensors can make out the entity orbiting Charm. Approaching would be devastating.</dialog>
<dialog>You are hailed by a distant ship. 

_"Traveller. We are the Worshipers. Things have been set in motion and there might still be time to dispel this danger. Seek us out at *Paxos Station*."_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Paxos Station"/>

<condition at-dest="Paxos Station" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog model="Paxos Station">_"This is Paxos Station, the Cathedral of Worship. The scholars at Pavonis Smoke have woken the Worm. You were their tool and now we can help you undo their foolish work."_</dialog>
<dialog model="Paxos Station">_"The Worm's chains can be restored with the three tools that once bound it originally."_</dialog>
<dialog model="Paxos Station">_"The children of the Worm once bound their progenitor with the artifacts Epiales, Momus and Horkos. Seek them out in the Fields, the Garden, and the Ruins."_</dialog>
<remove-map-marker/>

<condition have-item="Momus;Horkos;Epiales"/>
<mark-on-map dest="Paxos Station"/>

<condition have-item="Momus;Horkos;Epiales" at-dest="Paxos Station"/>
<dialog>_"Traveller. You have gathered the relics."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"While your hands were busy the Worm multiplied. Sired its seedlings.
May the relics help you. Clear out the Seedlings around *Charm*!"_</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Charm" />
<place-enemy dest="Charm Beta" enemy="Worm Seedling" loot=""/>
<place-enemy dest="Charm Gamma" enemy="Worm Seedling" loot=""/>
<place-enemy dest="Charm Delta" enemy="Worm Seedling" loot=""/>

<condition have-item="Momus;Horkos;Epiales" no-enemy-at-dest="Charm Beta;Charm Gamma;Charm Delta" />
<place-enemy dest="Charm" enemy="Weakened Worm" loot="Worm Umbra" />
<dialog model="Worm Seedling">The final Seedling succumbs to your assault. Somehow you know that the Worm is affected. Touched by your actions here that bestial presence is now weakened. This can now end.</dialog>

<condition no-enemy-at-dest="Charm" />
<dialog model="Worm">The worm is mortally wounded. Its appendages flail and whip up foam on the surface of Charm as it is pulled below the surface and into the depths of the gas giant.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Paxos Station" />

<condition at-dest="Paxos Station" />
<dialog>_"Traveller. You bested the Worm. The battle was glorious.
Yet many here feel fear. *The Worm is not dead.* It might slumber for eons inside Charm, but it will wake once again."_</dialog>
<dialog>_"We bestow upon you our highest honors and free access to the holy *Paxos Gate*"_</dialog>

quests.name: Poor Reception
quests.xml:
<condition state="surface" at-dest="NBN Station" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog>It is the local Nebular Broadcasting Network. You watch all of their shows.

_"Sorry, we are much to busy to handle visitors right now. Our relays are down!"_</dialog>
<dialog>You ask if they need any help.

"All of our spare Signal Capacitors are broken! And there are bandits stopping all trade to our provider at *Maxwell Station*"</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list />
<place-inventory dest="Maxwell Station" item="Signal Capacitor" />
<place-inventory dest="Maxwell Station" item="Signal Capacitor" />
<place-inventory dest="Maxwell Station" item="Signal Capacitor" />
<condition state="surface" at-dest="Maxwell Station" have-item="Signal Capacitor"/>
<dialog>You manage to get the *Signal Capacitors* that NBN need for their broadcasting relays. Now they just have to be installed.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="NBN Relay W" />
<condition state="surface" at-dest="NBN Relay W" have-item="Signal Capacitor" trigger="INSTALL CAPACITOR"/>
<take item="Signal Capacitor" />
<dialog>You replace the burnt out capacitor with a fresh one.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="NBN Relay H" />
<condition state="surface" at-dest="NBN Relay H" have-item="Signal Capacitor" trigger="INSTALL CAPACITOR"/>
<take item="Signal Capacitor" />
<dialog>You replace the burnt out capacitor with a fresh one.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="NBN Relay P" />
<condition state="surface" at-dest="NBN Relay P" have-item="Signal Capacitor" trigger="INSTALL CAPACITOR"/>
<take item="Signal Capacitor" />
<dialog>You replace the burnt out capacitor with a fresh one.</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="NBN Station" />
<condition at-dest="NBN Station" />
<dialog>_"We have perfect reception!!"_

_"The signal is back!! Amazing work. Here, take this compensation for your work."_</dialog>
<give credits="1200" />

quests.name: Locked Out
quests.xml:
<condition state="surface" at-dest="Drok Heights"/>
<dialog>
At the space station's airlock you see a suited figure. The person is banging on the controls.

Clearly in distress.
</dialog>

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Drok Heights" trigger="HAIL PERSON IN DISTRESS"/>
<dialog>
_"Help me! I have left my keys at work. On Pavonis Ember.

I need to get in!!"_
</dialog>
<place-item dest="Pavonis Ember" item="Lost keys" />

<condition state="surface" at-dest="Drok Heights" have-item="Lost keys" trigger="RETURN KEYS"/>
<dialog>_"Thank you! Please, take this as a reward."_</dialog>
<give credits="50"/>

quests.name: Pavonis Mining Co
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Pavonis A2934" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog ok="YES" cancel="NOT NOW">_"This is Pavonis Mining Co Headquarters. Are you looking for assignments?"_</dialog>
<dialog>_"There are rogues disturbing our operations at the north-west asteroid rim. We will pay 100 credits for clearing them out."_</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<condition no-enemy-at-dest="A117;A8761;A9753;A2170;A3566;A4976" at-dest="Pavonis A2934"/>
<dialog>_"Excellent work! Transferring reward now."_</dialog>
<dialog ok="ACCEPT" cancel="NOT NOW">_"Many of our contractors are damaged by the rogues. Would you like to run some mining operations? We rent out the needed equipment."_</dialog>
<give item="Mining Drill"/>

<mark-on-map dest="A2170"/>
<dialog>_"Readings at A2170 show rich ore. Start there."_</dialog>
<condition at-dest="A2170" have-item="Mining Drill" trigger="DRILL"/>
<give item="Pavonian Ore"/>

<mark-on-map dest="A8761"/>
<dialog>_"Readings at A8761 show rich ore. Continue there."_</dialog>
<condition at-dest="A8761" have-item="Mining Drill" trigger="DRILL"/>
<give item="Pavonian Mineral"/>

<mark-on-map dest="Pavonis A2934"/>
<condition have-item="Pavonian Mineral;Pavonian Ore" at-dest="Pavonis A2934"/>
<dialog>_"Good work, a bit slow, but good. Let us buy that mineral from you."_</dialog>
<take item="Pavonian Mineral"/>
<take item="Pavonian Ore"/>
<take item="Mining Drill"/>
<give credits="100"/>

quests.name: Harvest the Weaver
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Clear Skies" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog>
You hail the small base at the planet Clear Skies.

_"Welcome to Clear Skies. We are a team of astral historians who will pay good money for *Nebular Dust* samples from the *Weaver* Nebula to the west."_
</dialog>
<add-to-quest-list/>
<mark-on-map dest="Weaver Alpha" />
<condition have-item="Nebular Dust"/>
<dialog>The sample of Nebular Dust is fragile, more smoke than dust. Wonder what the historians at Clear Skies can decipher from this?</dialog>
<mark-on-map dest="Clear Skies" />
<condition have-item="Nebular Dust" at-dest="Clear Skies" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog>_"Excellent. These dust samples from Weaver are essential for our studies. Here, accept this compensation."_</dialog>
<take item="Nebular Dust" />
<give credits="100" />
<dialog>_"We can also sell you some of our refined products. Hail us if you are interested."_</dialog>
<condition at-dest="Clear Skies" have-credits="100" trigger="HAIL"/>
<dialog ok="BUY" cancel="NOT NOW">_"We produce large quantities of Sky Alloy in our research. We sell it for 100 credits per ingot.

Would you like to invest?"_</dialog>
<take credits="100" />
<give item="Sky Alloy" />

quests.name: Enter Pavonis Gate
quests.xml:
<condition at-dest="Tau Pavonis"/>
<mark id="sternrat-access" />
<mark-on-map dest="Paxos Gate" />
<condition state="surface" at-dest="Paxos Gate" trigger="ENTER GATE"/>
<travel dest="Belleros Gate"/>
<goto mark="sternrat-access"/>

quests.name: Enter Belleros Gate
quests.xml:
<mark-on-map dest="Belleros Gate" />
<mark id="paxos-access" />
<condition state="surface" at-dest="Belleros Gate" trigger="ENTER GATE"/>
<travel dest="Paxos Gate"/>
<goto mark="paxos-access"/>

quests.name: Hive Mind
quests.xml:
<condition state="space" at-dest="Eye of the Storm" trigger="TRIGGER"/>
<dialog model="Ursula">The freelancer's ship stops dead in front of you. A voice is heard in your cabin.

_"We have reached home. Come. Join us."_</dialog>
<dialog model="Ursula">
The freelancer turns toward you, her weapons hot.

*Betrayal!*
</dialog>
